intro: Hedyotis acerosa var. tamaulipana, commonly known as the Tamaulipan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer months. This variant is adapted to moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of streams.
